title: Ledger David 2014 Sangiovese (Rogue Valley)
description: This is a beefy wine with interesting components that suggest dried blood, compost, black cherry and cola. It's front loaded and flavorful, but turns a bit stemmy and tannic through the finish.

title: Leone de Castris 2015 50th Vintage Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)
description: This blend of 90% Negroamaro and 10% Malvasia Nera is bright in red currant and red cherry aromas, with dustings of saw dust and anise. Medium in weight and displaying lively acidity, the palate is racy and streamlined in crisp red-fruit flavors under a layer of vanilla.

title: Masseria Altemura 2016 Falanghina (Salento)
description: Apple peel, grapefruit and riper tropical fruit notions meld with a floral background in this light-bodied, crisp wine. The concentration is light, yet what's there is quite enjoyable.

title: Mocali 2016  Maremma Toscana
description: Made entirely from the native grape Ciliegiolo, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers raspberry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins.

title: Nein Lives 2016 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Delicate hints of yellow cherry and apple sweeten this uncomplicated but fresh wine. Off dry in style, it's pleasantly sweet and tart on a zesty lemonade finish. Drink now.

title: Omero 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Ripe red fruits combine into a pleasant, though generic style. There's a touch of earth underlying the tannins, and a high-toned edge to the aromatics.

title: Origin 2016 Omero Vineyard Rosé (Ribbon Ridge)
description: From the more experimental side of the Craft Wine Company, this rosé blends St. Laurent, Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Grüner Veltliner. The result is a pretty but somewhat dilute rosé, with thinnish raspberry fruit, rosewater and a touch of neutral wood. It's fully mature and should be consumed in the near term.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Undone Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)
description: Crisp raspberry and red cherry flavors are invigorating and fresh on the palate of this easy-drinking, juicy Pinot Noir. It's delicate in concentration and light in body but balanced by soft but pleasantly bitter tannins. A hint of vanilla lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Parras Wines 2016 Castelo do Sulco Colheita Red (Lisboa)
description: This blend of Syrah, Touriga Nacional and Petit Verdot is smooth, ripe and full of black-cherry and plum fruits. With its acidity, crisp texture and soft tannins, it will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Perelada NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This is a good but basic rosé Cava. Aromas of mild citrus fruits and vanilla lead to a good but basic palate with just enough energy and acidity. Cantaloupe and citrus-peel flavors are steady on the finish.

title: Poema NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Except for a hint of lime, this basic brut Cava smells neutral. A simple palate is citrusy and in solid shape. Generic white-fruit flavors come with mild green notes of celery and scallion. It's lively but lacks flavor on the finish.

title: RHEA 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine is fresh and forward, with simple but appealing flavors of raspberry and cherry candies. The flavors don't go any further than that, but for a fruity quaffable wine, it's quite well done.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2016 Syrosa Rosato (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with Syrah, this bright rosato offers scents of purple flower, citrus and red berry. The lively palate doles out pink grapefruit and pomegranate alongside crisp acidity.

title: Romeo 2012 Riserva dei Mandorli  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This has a funky nose of truffle, game, scorched soil and just a whiff of barnyard. The fleshy palate has a rustic allure, showing baked plum, blackberry extract, vanilla and the same truffle and gamy notes of the nose. Grainy dusty tannins provide the soft framework.

title: San Marzano 2016 Il Pumo Primitivo (Salento)
description: Aromas of ripe red berries and violets are fresh and light on the nose. A juicy, medium-bodied palate of blackberry and racy cranberry flavors shows good concentration, with floral accents that dot the finish.

title: Senhora do Convento 2012 Red (Douro)
description: This ripe wine is full of black fruit as well as a serious tannin structure. Rich, concentrated, juicy with berry flavors and with layers of acidity, it strikes a balance between firm tannins and black fruit.

title: Summit Lake 2012 Sophia Lynn Petite Syrah (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a velvety thick and oaky red, aged some time in bottle. Somewhat herbal in clove, cedar and graphite notes, its texture is defined more by leather.

title: Sunset Hills 2013 Mosaic Red (Virginia)
description: This Bordeaux-style blend is comprised of mainly Cabernet Franc and rounded out with Merlot and Petit Verdot. This wine offers black currant, black plum and pepper, with additions of toasty clove, nutmeg and charred wood. Barnyard and fig bring depth of character to the mix. The acidity is bright and the tannins are present but soft. The finish is long and full of oak spice.

title: The Pines 1852 2015 Merlot (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Sourced from both Volcano Ridge and The Pines vineyards, this is a smooth, supple wine, 100% varietal, with a mix of plum and blueberry fruit. Somewhat high toned and bright, it is ready to drink over the next couple of years.

title: Tormentoso 2015 Old Vine Cinsault (Paarl)
description: There's a warm, ripe character to this wine, which boasts generous waves of macerated berries and cherries throughout. Accents of licorice, star anise and curing spice lend interest to the round, creamy palate. It's an easy, fruity pour that's best enjoyed now.

title: Vinum 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: There's the slightest pink tint to the color of this bottling, which shows baked apple and poached pear aromas on the ripe but pleasant nose. The palate is also quite ripe, showing more cooked pome fruit and squeezed lime, with a decent texture.

title: Windrun 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling is very mellow and shy on many fronts, though it emerges from its shell with patience. Light aromas of red fruit and dark spice lead into a palate with a full mouthfeel, carrying flavors of raspberry, rose petal, loam and eventually sharp baking spice.

title: Cantina del Giusto 2014 Baradiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: This opens with aromas of red berry, underbrush, mint and leather. The palate is more straightforward, offering blackberry, powdered sage and hints of baking spice set against bright acidity and dusty, not very persistent tannins.

title: Caricature 2015 Red (California)
description: Effusive aromas of strawberry and raspberry lead to rich, equally fruity flavors and a velvety texture that balances some tannin with a touch of ripeness. It's a full-bodied, mouth-coating and smooth blend.

title: Boeger 2015 Milagro Red (El Dorado)
description: Interesting bay leaf and clove aromas are followed by focused and bright black-cherry flavors and a vivid texture shaped by firm acidity and moderate tannins. It has a lean and lively feel and no oakiness.

title: Boomtown 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of dark fruit, smoked meat and herb lead to plentiful plum flavors that miss a bit in the middle. It comes up short on the finish but otherwise provides appeal.

title: Château Ricaudet 2015  Médoc
description: This small 20-acre property is now run by the fourth generation of the Couthures family. The wine is full of fruit, with a backup of ripe tannins. Barrel aging has smoothed out the tannins and added some spice to the mix. Drink the wine from 2022.

title: Dalton 2016 Estate Oak Aged Chenin Blanc (Galilee)
description: Medium straw in color, this wine features aromas of apple and honeysuckle. It is tart at first sip, with flavors of lemon-lime and Gala apple that are slowly overtaken by strong notes of eucalyptus. Fruit flavors return on the finish, offering a closing note of pear.

title: Castellroig NV Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Dusty aromas suggest apple. A full, round palate is soda-like and not precise, while this tastes of lightly spiced apple with a dusting of powdered sugar. A short, mellow finish is nondescript.

title: Château Haut Grignon 2015  Médoc
description: The 67% of Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine gives it both richness and a firm structure. It is a solid wine, still showing its oak aging but with juicy fruit and acidity. It will develop as it softens, so drink from 2022.
